abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental and social assessment
            concerning the implementation of the Emergency Community
            Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project, will guide, and
            support infrastructure subprojects, aiming to maintain
            regional balance, and equity among  ethnic religious groups,
            with consideration to the variations in population density.
            An environmental screening process shall determine the
            environmental category of each subproject, and whether it
            warrants an environmental assessment, or, an environmental
            management plan alone. Attached are samples of
            questionnaires to be conducted prior to subproject approval.
            It is specified cultural property, which includes monuments,
            works of art, or sites of significance points of view,
            defined as having archaeological, historical, architectural,
            or religious significance - will be avoided, and, should new
            finds occur the authorities should be notified, and steps
            shall be taken to preserve archaeological sites. Mitigation
            measures include good engineering design, to prevent further
            deterioration in the quantity, and quality of groundwater,
            and, in the absence of water supply networks, the project
            will assess feasible alternative/temporary options on a
            case-by-case basis, in compliance with the local ecology
            aspects. Wastewater must not enter streams without settling
            ponds, filters, or other processes. Co-ordination with
            stakeholders, and nongovernmental organizations (NGOs) must
            begin in the design phase itself. The natural landscape
            shall be preserved to the extent possible, through
            operations that prevent unnecessary destruction, or scarring
            of natural surroundings. The report also addresses potential
            resettlement, and compensation issues, including in
            particular, ethnic groups to ensure these groups
            participate, and benefit from the project implementation.
            Grievance mechanisms will be in place to assure compliance
            with these safeguards.
